intro: Calamus retrophyllus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed calamus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arecaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its slender, creeping rhizomes and narrow, elongated leaves. It produces small, clustered inflorescences with yellowish-green flowers. Calamus retrophyllus is often found in wetland or swampy habitats, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
